Operation 'createBooking' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. The current summary uses 'Orders' terminology which is inconsistent with the hotel booking domain context (should use 'booking' or 'reservation'). The description is completely empty, providing no guidance on operation purpose, required inputs (guest details, payment, offer selection), expected outputs (confirmation reference, status), or side effects (provider commitment, payment processing). An AI agent cannot determine when or how to use this operation without this critical information. The improved version clarifies the domain-specific action (hotel booking), specifies required inputs aligned with the Stakeholder, Payment, and HotelBookingLight schemas, explains the return value and side effects, and provides context for when to use this operation in a booking workflow.

data.current_summary: Create Orders associated to the Hotel Offers
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new hotel booking reservation based on a selected hotel offer. Requires guest details (name, contact information), payment information, and the hotel offer details. The operation confirms the reservation with the hotel provider and returns a booking confirmation with a unique booking reference number, confirmation details, and reservation status. This operation has side effects: it commits the reservation with the hotel provider and may trigger payment processing. Use this operation after selecting a specific hotel offer from search results.
